alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Heavy rain with embedded thunder will impact portions of northwestern Hampshire and central Franklin Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Goshen, or 12 miles northwest of Northampton, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Deerfield, Montague, Sunderland, Williamsburg, Bernardston, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Leverett, Shutesbury, Ashfield, Colrain, Gill, Whately, Chesterfield, Goshen, Cummington, Leyden and Plainfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire
